article.title: CAS computer-Based Information Services
article.author: Davenport, W.C.
article.text: This paper describes the key points that characterize CAS' approach to large scale scientific-technical information systems that must handle over 100,000 documents per year. The first of these points is the "single analysis/multiple use" concept. Intellectual ability is a rare commodity and essential to an information service. Therefore, it makes sense to conserve that commodity and not use manpower to perform repetitive jobs or to waste effort analyzing information.
